text: Does activation of the <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene occur in a majority of patients with T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ?
Almost 25 % of patients with T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( T-ALL ) have tumor - specific rearrangements of the <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

Although <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression has not been observed in normal lymphocytes , <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene products are readily detected in leukemic cells that harbor a rearranged <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> allele .
Hence , it has been proposed that ectopic expression of <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promotes the development of T-ALL .

In this report , we show that <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is expressed in the leukemic cells of most patients with T-ALL , including many that do not display an apparent <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene alteration .

A polymorphic dinucleotide repeat in the transcribed sequences of <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was used to determine the allele specificity of <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription in primary T-ALL cells .

Monoallelic expression of <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed in the leukemic cells of all patients ( 8 of 8 ) bearing a <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene rearrangement .

In the leukemic cells of patients without detectable <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> rearrangements , <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription occurred in either a monoallelic ( 3 of 7 patients ) or a biallelic ( 4 of 7 patients ) fashion .

Thus , <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation in these patients may result from subtle alterations in cis - acting regulatory sequences ( affecting expression of a single <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> allele ) or changes in trans - acting factors that control <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription ( affecting expression of both <extra_id_0> TAL1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alleles ) .
